Articles.Content:
After 120 years of exploration, rocket testing, science and what not, the boys at mission control found out where all the missing paperwork was. Turns out there are a few Kerbals missing in action.

36 of them. 36! How did this happen? No one seems to want to step forward and take the responsibility. So... The decision has been made to shut down all further exploration until every Kerbal is back on Kerbin's soil (or water - close enough)

A full inventory was taken and a basic strategy established for each Kerbal crew situation.

Javascript is disabled. View full album

The plan is to get this underway and gradually update the album and this OP regarding progress. Thoughts?

Cheers,

W.

================

MISSION ONE

Thanks to Mission Control not paying attention to the Physics warp setting, our proud heroes Dean, Ludgas and Wilbald will now be memorialised on the astronaut complex wall of remembrance.

(Next... Mission 2 - same procedure for Bill, Bob and Jeb - only Mission Control knows that can't screw up again!)

Edited June 7, 2014 by Wallygator
Updated - Mission 1
I think you should make separate albums for each mission.
